reflectionQuestions.prompt: How does this connect to me?
Try applying this in the real world.

notebooks.title: The One World Schoolhouse
notebooks.author: Salman Khan
notebooks.notes:
This was a great book.

People should be learning at their own paces, and should learn beneficial stuff until they have mastered it until being labeled with some arbitrary standard of intelligence.

- "Never let schooling interfere with education" - Mark Twain

Our modern education system is from what Sal Khan calls "the broken model" (aka the Prussian Model)

Check out mastery learning - really check it out.
Runs website: Khan Academy

technology could revolutionize learning

notebooks.title: The Blue Zones of Happiness
notebooks.author: Dan Buettner
notebooks.notes:
This was an inspiring book.

Always take walks outdoors in nature.
Meditate.

Be around communities - family ties - find religion.
eat healthy
manage your money well
stay active

notebooks.title: Who Killed Malcolm X?
notebooks.author: Abdur-Rahman Muhammad
notebooks.notes:
What a BASED documentary
Don't believe everything that the media tells you. :)

Two of the accused didn't do it. It was someone who got away with it.

It was 5 men who killed him not 3.

FBI was involved.
Alongside NOI.

All the real killers are now deceased.
Many in New York knew who the real killers are but wouldn't talk about it.

J Edgar Hoover was desparate to make Malcolm X look bad.
